description: Object containing top-level metadata information about the retrieved tax calculation.

calculationId.description: The unique identifier of the calculation.

taxYear.description: The tax year in which the calculation was performed.

requestedBy.description: The requester of the calculation. Currently "customer" will be returned even in the case of an agent submission.

requestedTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the calculation was requested in ISO 8601 UTC format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

calculationReason.description: The reason why the calculation was triggered.

oneOf.description: The calculation was triggered by the customer via software.
The calculation was triggered internally by HMRC once the actual Class 2 NIC amount became available. This event is only applicable for an in-year "final-declaration" calculation type.

The calculation was triggered by HMRC on receipt of a new pre-MTD brought forward loss made by the customer. This event is only applicable for a "final-declaration" calculation type. This event is not currently supported and will be supported in the future.

The calculation was triggered by HMRC on receipt of a new loss claim made by the customer. This event is only applicable for a "final-declaration" calculation type. This event is not currently supported and will be supported in the future.

The calculation was triggered internally by HMRC on receipt of an updated loss claim made by the customer. This event is only applicable for a "final-declaration" calculation type. This event is not currently supported and will be supported in the future.

The calculation was triggered internally by HMRC on receipt of an updated pre-MTD brought forward loss made by the customer. This event is only applicable for a "final-declaration" calculation type. This event is not currently supported and will be supported in the future.
The calculation was triggered internally by HMRC on receipt of a request for a new adjustable summary calculation by the customer. This event is not currently supported.
The calculation was triggered internally by HMRC on receipt of an adjustment to an adjustable summary calculation made by the customer. This event is not currently supported.
HMRC has updated the calculation for you. You can see more details in your record-keeping software.

calculationTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the calculation was performed in ISO 8601 UTC format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

oneOf.description: Cannot be used for a final declaration.
Can be used when submitting a final declaration.

intentToSubmitFinalDeclaration.description: A boolean to indicate whether the calculation can be used to make a final declaration. This value must be true or false.

finalDeclaration.description: A boolean to indicate whether the calculation has been used to make a final declaration. This value must be true or false.

finalDeclarationTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the calculation was performed in ISO 8601 UTC format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

periodFrom.description: This defines the earliest date from which the calculation was performed. This will be the accounting period start date (for self-employments) or the tax year start date, whichever occurs first for the income sources supplied.

periodTo.description: This defines the latest date to which the calculation was performed and will be the point in the year to which income has been submitted.
